SEARCH
Package com.example.soroban.model

Class Event

java.lang.Object
com.example.soroban.model.Event
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Event extends Object implements Serializable
Stores any relevant information that is related to an event such as name, date, attendees, and facility. Manages user interaction and event participation
See Also:
  • User
  • Facility
  • UserList

  • Constructor Details

    • Event

      public Event()
      No-argument constructor required by Firestore.

    • Event

      public Event(User owner, Facility facility, String eventName, Date eventDate, Date drawDate, int sampleSize)
      Constructor method for an Event.
      Parameters:
      owner - : User object of the owner of the event.
      facility - : Facility object that the event is hosted at.
      eventName - : name string of the event.
      eventDate - : date of the event.
      drawDate - : date when the participants of an event are drawn.
      sampleSize - : number of participants drawn.

    • getNumberOfNotifications

      public int getNumberOfNotifications()
      Getter method for an Event's Number of Notifications. This is the current number of scheduled notifications an Event is outputting during this app's runtime. It is not stored in Firebase and is reset when the app is reloaded.

    • addNumberOfNotifications

      public void addNumberOfNotifications()
      Adds one an Event's Number of Notifications. This is the current number of scheduled notifications an Event is outputting during this app's runtime. It is not stored in Firebase and is reset when the app is reloaded.

    • sampleEntrants

      public ArrayList<Integer> sampleEntrants(int entrantNumber)
      Randomly samples the Event's sample size number of entrants to be invited
      Parameters:
      entrantNumber - number of entrants that will be sampled (will be replaced by the size of the waitlist if said size is smaller)

    • equals

      public boolean equals(Object o)
      Checks if one Event object is equal to another..
      Overrides:
      equals in class Object
      Returns:
      Return true if an Event object is equal to this Event object, or if all fields of the Event object are equal to all fields of this Event object. Returns false otherwise.
